source: Following the steps of Kythaela, you came across a ruined keep beside a river. Apparently, a caravan has set up camp there - a rarity in these desolate lands.
Following the steps of Kythaela, you came across a ruined keep beside a river. Apparently, a caravan has set up camp there - a rarity in these desolate lands.
Near this ruined Tirmarian monastery, inside a Manacalon mausoleum, you found an elf wizard, seemingly kept in a trance ever since the Cataclysm.
The crownbearer saw an image of this place. It's possible the Crown sent a hint of where to look for one of its gems. Investigate this location.
This dry river bed holds an old Tirmarian monastery and a Solastan building.
Here, near the ancient Manacalon capital, the Rift that almost destroyed Solasta opened - and was eventually closed. The land bears the scars of the Cataclysm.
The ancient Master of Necromancy was hiding with his gem in this massive and forbidding keep, surrounded by undead creatures and other dangers.
The crownbearer saw an image of this place. It's possible the Crown sent a hint of where to look for one of its gems. Investigate this location.
A gigantic keep rises out of the woods. One of the Crown's gems might be within.
Captain Henrik's garrison was wiped out by the Soraks, and you barely escaped with a couple of survivors. The outpost might be reclaimed so the exploration of the Badlands can continue.
This old Imperial fort was reoccupied by the Legacy Council's troops as a Badlands outpost, but the garrison's commander, Captain Henrik, has not sent any reports for some time.
This old Imperial fort was reoccupied by the Legacy Council's troops as a Badlands outpost, but the garrison's commander, Captain Henrik, has not sent any reports for some time.
The magnificent capital of the Principality of Masgarth, Caer Cyflen was a major Imperial city and a strategic base for the Manacalon Empire long before the Cataclysm.

You have learned that this old tower was probably the home of a powerful Manacalon wizard… maybe even a Master of the Arcaneum. In a hidden room, you found a mysterious Crown guarded by a group of Soraks.
According to the survivors at Caer Lem, this is where their scouts were exploring before the Soraks attacked. Perhaps you will find some trace here of these legendary Tirmarian monsters.
An ancient tower from Imperial times.
This mining town in the Marches was infiltrated by Soraks, but is now free of their influence.
Kythaela indicated that this mining town is important. You have no choice but to follow her, hoping to find one of the Crown's gems.
Feuding orc clans went to war deep within the volcano after a shaman found the Gem of Evocation in the ruins of an ancient Manacalon city buried by lava.
The crownbearer saw a vision of this place - possibly a hint from the Crown. Investigate this location.
This great volcano is still active. One of the Crown's gems may be among the lava flows.
The Master of Illusion has created himself an invisible shelter… TBC
The Crown is responding strongly. Perhaps one of its gems is nearby!
Kythaela finally led you to this place, a Manacalon wizard tower, apparently perfectly preserved and protected by magic, while its surroundings were ravaged by the Cataclysm.
Kythaela is now certain to know where the master is. Hopefully, this will lead you to another Crown gem.
A resting place for plenipotentiaries and hosts of the Crown.
The mansion of the honorable Joan Tannerson.
The mansion and its gardens are the main prize of Tannerson's heritage. The finalization of the will is going to take place there.
Rodric and his minions were hiding in this ancient section of Caer Cyflen's sewers.
A small farming village not far from Caer Cyflen.
You've been sent here to investigate a possible group of Arivad cultists.
This place is a typical Badlands area, where the greenest nature neighbors rivers of lava and sulfur pits. It might shelter one of the Crown's gems.
This place is a typical Badlands area, where the greenest nature neighbors rivers of lava and sulfur pits.
This was the hiding place of the Master of Conjuration, in a magical fortress built by his broken mind.
A farmhouse in the Vale of Coparann which belongs to your family.
You passed by these ruins when traveling to Coparann with Kythaela.
Daliat indicated that this place was a fortified hideout where Silent Whisper traitors were hiding.
This is where the temple of the Lost God is supposed to be, according to Arwin Merton, but only he knows the way through the mist.
This is where you found the temple of the Lost God and vanquished the Remorhaz that was guarding its secrets.
You followed Illoreth to this place, hoping to catch some Arivad cultists in the middle of their wrongdoings.
A sandy canyon in a desolate land.
A gloomy and stinky swamp in the middle of the Badlands.
A ruined building that was part of an elven city.
A refreshing landscape, a flowing river, and roaming monsters.
An old cemetery in the middle of the path… probably haunted.
A mysterious place of magic and… irrationality!
Another dead hill in the Badlands, scorched by an unforgiving sun.
A lonely hunting cabin in the middle of a grim marsh.
A campsite in the Marches, on top of a mountain.
A place that travelling merchants commonly use to stay for the night.
A place that travelling merchants commonly use to stay for the night, especially Galar Goldentongue.
A campsite in the Marches, on top of a mountain.
A city on a plateau, in the middle of the jungle
A campsite in the Marches, on top of a mountain.
A campsite in the Marches, on top of a mountain.
